moves.3. Bc4: No Ruy Lopez, considered then as now the strongest 3rd move in this position. But Morphy makes the "Quiet Game" roar!
moves.4... f5: Overaggressive. This move opens the diagonal for the B and will make it difficult for Black to castle.
moves.5. d4: Morphy opens up the game at once with the Black King stuck in the center.
moves.5... exd4: Refusing to take won't help, as Morphy will simply capture on his move and open the lines.
moves.6. e5: Momentarily preventing Schulten from defending with... N-KB3.
moves.6... d6: An attempt to get rid of the obnoxious White KP.
moves.7. exd6: Morphy fully opens the K file.
moves.7... Qxd6: Electing to put a piece in play with the recapture.
moves.8... Nge7: Because of his 4th move, Black still can't castle into safety.
moves.9. Ng5: Threatening a devastating Knight fork at KB7.
moves.10. Bf4: Pinning the Knight and again threatening to fork.
moves.10... Ne7g6: Guarding the Knight, but unable to do anything about the weak spot at his KB2.
moves.11. Bxe5: Prolonging the game by a move.
moves.12. Nf7: Fork and game. Schulten resigns at once.
